Articles.Content:
Seriously, what is going to happen?

EDIT: Wait, SQUAD SPONSORED?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T01:14:38Z" title="04/28/2015 01:14  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by RAINCRAFTER**
WHAT Lets see the sales graph after this!!!!???????

"Pewdiepie"

***REST IN PEACE KSP***
My god, are there someone who still watch such things?

> 
> "Pewdiepie"
> ***REST IN PEACE KSP***

Being KSP it would be:

***REST IN PIECES, KSP***

*Eh*

My days liking PewDiePie is over. It was cool seeing him play KSP, but I don't think he was really into it.
Lemme guess - lots of stuff blown up, nothing really put into space, lots of stupid jokes, and a very poor representation of the game's features?

Now watch for the millions of "hou do i space?" and "pwedipie brugt m3 hre bros!" threads popping up from all of the PewDiePie fanboys. ![:0.0:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_shocked.gif)
We better seek cover while the KSP community gets bombarded by 12 year old fanboys

The more the merrier. I welcome anyone. It's not an exclusive club limited to only the space nerds (Excelsior!... ahem). And that many more people knowing even just a tidbit more about how orbital motion works is a delight.

Ew.

Here's the video, for anyone wondering: 

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ho70DT1Fvdw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Pewd's style doesn't really seem funny to me. Guess it's because I've grown up since the last time I watched his stuff (Still in my teens, shouldn't be saying that), but it just looks too... childish.

Anyway, the description says that "Kerbal Space Program", not "SQUAD", sponsored the video... So SQUAD obviously saw the potential for new buyers with the 1.0 release and decided that it would make sense. However, I don't expect a lot of these kids to stay around the forum very much.

If they do, at least they'll learn something useful. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T01:51:52Z" title="04/28/2015 01:51  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by astropapi1**

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/umDr0mPuyQc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

my reaction to seeing this

> 
> If they do, at least they'll learn something useful. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yeh darn kids! Stop doin' them fancy Pew-dee-pay drugs and git ovar heere! We gonna teach you kids a lesson... on orbital mechanics

> 
> Yeh darn kids! Stop doin' them fancy Pew-dee-pay drugs and git ovar heere! We gonna teach you kids a lesson... on orbital mechanics

Don't do drugs! Do a degree in physics.

Seems good for kids.
Atleast he's spreading the KSP gospel. Though he could have at least watched a tutorial first...

I remember being 9 and I'd almost certainly find PDP a larf a minute. In fact, these were a little bit before my time but:

![bozo2d.gif](http://www.tvparty.com/vgifs8/bozo2d.gif)

![51Ogp3KmcuL._SL500_AA280_.jpg](http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51Ogp3KmcuL._SL500_AA280_.jpg)

these guys aren't all that different from what PewDiePie does.

> 
> Lemme guess - lots of stuff blown up, nothing really put into space, lots of stupid jokes, and a very poor representation of the game's features?

Interestingly, Jacksepticeye's (he's another popular youtuber and knows poods) first KSP video (or two) was kind of like that. Then he started watching Scott Manley, learned to orbit, made it to the moon, and even learned how to dock. So who knows?

EDIT: Can't much stand poods myself though for very long. His video was somewhat painful.

This is all I have to say:

"CARTMANBRAH"

![1809-preview.jpg?quality=0.8](http://2.images.southparkstudios.com/blogs/southparkstudios.com/files/2014/12/1809-preview.jpg?quality=0.8)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-28T02:06:50Z" title="04/28/2015 02:06  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 28, 2015</time> by Holyvision**

My reaction.

" WHAT ARE YOU DOING PEWDIEPIE ARE YOU INSANE"

That was my reaction half the time.
Part of me says it's good if more younger people are interested in space, Part of me says "Get to cover, Now."

I could not make it even half way through that video. It is funny watching someone that does not know what they are doing, but it is different when they are not even trying to understand what they are doing.

> 
> Part of me says it's good if more younger people are interested in space, Part of me says "Get to cover, Now."

Same here. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> I could not make it even half way through that video. It is funny watching someone that does not know what they are doing, but it is different when they are not even trying to understand what they are doing.

Couldn't agree more, I don't know what other word to use to describe it other than disrespectful ....

> 
> This is all I have to say:
> "CARTMANBRAH"
> 
> [http://2.images.southparkstudios.com/blogs/southparkstudios.com/files/2014/12/1809-preview.jpg?quality=0.8](http://2.images.southparkstudios.com/blogs/southparkstudios.com/files/2014/12/1809-preview.jpg?quality=0.8)

#cartmanbrahmustdie #rightafterpewdiepie

Although he did have a fascinating commentary on Pewdiepie's KSP video.

or, to be fully honest:

![Farnsworth.png](http://alpha.renegrade.net/images/Farnsworth.png)

I'm pretty sure a lot of the cringe-worthy incompetence shown in the video was Pewds hamming it up for the camera. He knows his audience well.

And if it means a whole ton more people buying the game and flooding the forums? Good. More people is more fun. The serious rocket-scientist types can carry on with their RSS/RO-fueled NASA simulations, the lelsokerbal types can carry on blowing stuff up, and the idiotic trolls can taste banhammer.

I fail to see the problem.
